description: Numbers n such that n | Sigma(n) * Phi(n) and n not congruent to 0 (mod 6).
references: George E. Andrews, "Number Theory," Dover Books, NY, 1971, Page 84.
mathematica: Do[ If[ Mod[ n, 6 ]!=0, If[ Mod[ DivisorSigma[ 1, n ]*EulerPhi[ n ], n ]==0, Print[ n ] ] ], {n, 1, 25000} ]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 22 2000
